text: Abigail "Abi" Walker is a Scottish surgeon and retired international female field hockey goalkeeper. She made 65 appearances for the Women's National Team and won 17 caps for Great Britain. ==Biography== Walker studied medicine at the University of Glasgow and qualified as a doctor in 2006. She passed her postgraduate examinations and gained MRCS in 2009. Walker played for Canterbury Hockey Club and Bearsden. She gained her first cap for Scotland against Chile in 2003. In February 2013, she announced her decision to retire from international competition, having made 65 appearances for the Scotland team. In 2018, Walker was selected as a Churchill Fellow to investigate treatments for adults and children with facial pain in the United States. ==References== Category:Living people Category:Scottish female field hockey players Category:Female field hockey goalkeepers Category:21st-century Scottish medical doctors Category:Alumni of the University of Glasgow Medical School Category:Scottish surgeons Category:Field hockey players at the 2010 Commonwealth Games Category:Field hockey players at the 2012 Summer Olympics Category:Scottish women medical doctors Category:21st-century women physicians Category:Surbiton Hockey Club players Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Olympic field hockey players of Great Britain
title: Abi Walker
